name: Lost Roll, Inc.
tag_list: pics, pictures, lost, find, find-your-pic, memories, free, reconnect, locate
overview:
Did you ever lose a roll of film and wonder what happened to it? Or did you ever wonder if other people might have some old pics of you? A new picture sharing website has been launched in Chicago that allows users to post long lost pictures and memories; so others may view pictures of that may have been lost over the years.

LostRoll.com is FREE, contains no ads, and doesn’t require a membership or password to utilize the service. The staff at Lost Roll Inc. believes in keeping it simple. The website requests users to agree to its usage terms and refer three potential users to post pics to the Lost Roll Library.

The website also offers various social networking links, so the user can share, refer and notify others of pics they have seen on the LostRoll website. The website’s focus isn’t postings of pics from the weekend before, but rather pics throughout the decades others may have lost or may have not seen. The idea behind the website came from today’s state of the economy and the company hopes its website serves as “online comfort food” for users to remember the good old days. That is why the website is strictly built on a platform of simplicity so that various users with find it easy to use.

Lost Roll Inc. decided to launch the site in Chicago, along other promising start-ups, hoping this area’s resources will catapult the website nationwide. The website is in its phase one, launch stage and plans to expand the website as it acquires more users. As users notice pictures of people they know, they can easily submit the “I Saw Your Pic” notification to a friend so that they can enjoy a pic they may have never seen.

The company plans on increasing the level of users and creating additional applications that will compliment the site. So, dig through your old photos and videos, go to LostRoll.com and post away!
